attributes.action: Mr Cameron's reckless statements impact the independance of a panel & a sportsmen's career
attributes.additional_details:
Mr Cameron's reckless statements impact on an independant panel's ability to work and the career of a sportsmen.

I would like someone to ask the PM, Mr Cameron, the following questions: Why does Mr Cameron feel it appropriate to pass judgement and comment on a sportsmen who is in the process of being punished for a sporting error by an independent panel?  Does Mr Cameron agree that it was incredibly stupid for him to make comments which would be likely to influence the panel and impact on their ability to be impartial? Apart from trying to boost his own ratings, what does Mr Cameron feel he achieved by publicly attacking a man who had already, unreservedly accepted his error, paid a fine to charity, issued apologies to all? Does Mr Cameron make it a habit to kick hard working men when they are down?
